how are things for you altaz
god i hate fake contrast while mapping
fake contrast as in orthogonal walls being colored differently?
No matter how round and natural looking your rocks are, no matter how many times you've spent finding for that one straight aligned line
I mean it works when you are working with lot of boxy or angular shapes
there will ALWAYS be another one in some place you didn't see before
to be honest i so rarely ever register it unless i'm working with rather dark areas
But when you try to do natural curves like madman (aka like I), it always just stikcs out
I never have straight grid-aligned lines in my rocks, ever
I unlearned that a long time ago
yeah i do chunkier rocks with plenty of orthogonal stuff. i like it
the only time I ever deign to use them is if I have even lighting set in MAPINFO
but, sometimes, I dunno, I just forget lol
I set that for all my maps now
i don't go full nilla tarns "only 45 degree lines allowed" but i use my fair share of orthogonal shit
I know that it won't be a problem in zdoom ports at least heh
I do love me some diagonal rooms though
in my map The Molehill I consciously used only 45ยบ lines
In fact, every texture set should have 45 degree angled version of all the other flats

it's the other extreme I've gone to in terms of the fake contrast thing
so yeah, this looks like blue
the sky's light purple with a bit of blue yeah
